com.vistamaresoft.rwgui

Class GuiMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiElement
      • net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiPanel
        • com.vistamaresoft.rwgui.GuiModalWindow
          • com.vistamaresoft.rwgui.GuiMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.risingworld.api.events.Listener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GuiUsersMenu

    public class GuiMenu
extends GuiModalWindow
    A class implementing a modal menu. Each menu is made of a top title bar, with title and close button, and a number of text items which can be clicked to select. The items are arranged vertically and the menu is shown in the middle of the player screen. The menu adapts its vertical and horizontal sizes to the number and length of the texts.

    If there are more than 12 items, the menu displays them in chunks of 12, with an up and a down button to page among the chunks.

    GuiMenu inherits all the behaviours and methods of GuiModalWindow, including the management of the mouse cursor, of click events, of the close button and of the 'display stack'.

    If the autoClose parameter is set to true in the constructor, the menu will automatically 'pop' itself away, closing and freeing itself, when an item is clicked on. If the autoClose parameter is set to false, the menu will remain on the screen, and another GuiModalWindow can be 'pushed' above it, or it can be closed and freed manually.

    Important: due to the way Rising World plug-ins are loaded, this class cannot instantiated or used in any way from within the onEnable() method of a plug-in, as it is impossible to be sure that, at that moment, the RWGui plug-in has already been loaded.

    The first moment one can be sure that all plug-ins have been loaded, and it is safe to use this class, is when (or after) the first player connects to the server (either dedicated or local).

    • Constructor Detail

      • GuiMenu

        public GuiMenu(net.risingworld.api.Plugin plugin,
               java.lang.String titleText,
               RWGui.RWGuiCallback callback,
               boolean autoClose)
        Creates a new GuiMenu.
        Parameters:
        plugin - the plug-in the GuiMenu is intended for. This is only needed to manage the internal event listener and has no effects on the plug-in itself.
        titleText - the text of the title.
        callback - the callback object to which to report events. Can be null, but in this case no event will reported until an actual callback object is set with the setCallback() method.
        autoClose - whether the menu should automatically close when an item is selected or not.

      • GuiMenu

        public GuiMenu(net.risingworld.api.Plugin plugin,
               java.lang.String titleText,
               RWGui.RWGuiCallback callback)
        Creates a new GuiMenu with autoClose enabled.
        Parameters:

        titleText - the text of the title.
        callback - the callback object to which to report events. Can be null, but in this case no event will reported until an actual callback object is set with the setCallback() method.

      • onClick

        public void onClick(net.risingworld.api.events.player.gui.PlayerGuiElementClickEvent event)
        Overrides:
        onClick in class GuiModalWindow

      • addChild

        public void addChild(java.lang.String text,
                     java.lang.Integer id,
                     java.lang.Object data)
        Adds a new menu item with the associated id and data.

        id can be any Integer and id's should be all different from one another within each dialogue box.

        The data parameter can be any Java object and can store additional information required to deal with the element, when a click event is reported for it via the callback object. It can also be null if no additional info is needed for the element.

        id and data are reported by the callback object upon click events.

        Parameters:
        text - the text of the new menu item.
        id - the id associated with the item.
        data - the data associated with the element; may be null for elements which need no additional data other than their id.

      • removeChild

        public int removeChild(int itemIndex)
        Removes the menu item at the itemIndex index. Item indices start from 0.
        Parameters:
        itemIndex - the index of the menu item to remove.
        Returns:
        the index of the removed item or ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER if the index was not valid.

      • removeItem

        @Deprecated
public int removeItem(int itemIndex)
        Deprecated. 

      • removeChild

        public int removeChild(java.lang.String itemText)
        Removes the first menu item with given item text. To match, the item text should be exactly the same, capitalisation included.

        If more items with the same text exist, only the first is removed.

        Parameters:
        itemText - the text of the menu item to remove.
        Returns:
        the index of the removed item or ERR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND if the the no item has that string as item text.

      • removeItem

        @Deprecated
public int removeItem(java.lang.String itemText)
        Deprecated. 

      • layout

        public void layout()
        Description copied from class: GuiModalWindow
        Lays the window out, arranging all the children of the layout hierarchy. This method is always called before showing the window to a player and it is usually not necessary to call it manually.
        Overrides:
        layout in class GuiModalWindow

      • show

        public void show(net.risingworld.api.objects.Player player)
        Displays the menu on the player screen.
        Overrides:
        show in class GuiModalWindow
        Parameters:
        player - the player to show the dialogue box to.

      • close

        public void close(net.risingworld.api.objects.Player player)
        Closes (hides) the menu from the player screen, turning the mouse cursor off.

        The menu resources are not freed and the menu can be re-used if needed; when the menu is no longer needed, its resources must be freed with the free() method, in addition to closing it.

        Overrides:
        close in class GuiModalWindow
        Parameters:
        player - the player from whose screen to remove the menu. Removing the same menu from the same player multiple times has no effect and does no harm.

      • free

        public void free()
        Releases the resources used by the menu. After this method has been called, the menu cannot be used or displayed any longer. The resources are in any case garbage collected once the dialogue box goes out of scope or all the references to it elapse. Using this method might be useful to speed up the garbage collection process, once the dialogue box is not longer needed.
        Overrides:
        free in class GuiModalWindow
